Commemoration Meeting of Publication in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- A meeting was reportedly held in Seoul on Nov. 11 in commemoration of the publication of a "report on the massacre of civilians before and after the Korean War".
 The report contains more than 700 cases of massacre of civilians according to kind and scale of casualties. Among them are massacres before the June 25 war, massacre related to the Association of the Protected, massacre of suspects of compulsory labor and massacre by the U.S. forces.
 Speakers at the meeting hoped that the report would be a guide in clearly understanding the scale and truth of the reduced and distorted cases of massacres of civilians and asked those concerned to make positive efforts for a probe into the massacre cases.    
 Present at the meeting were members of the "All People Committee for Probe into Truth behind the Massacres of Civilians before and after the Korean War and Reinstatement" and bereaved families.

Greetings to Syrian President
    Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Bashar Al-Assad, president of Syria, on the occasion of the 35th anniversary of the corrective movement in Syria.
 The message sincerely wished the president and the people of Syria greater success in their efforts for a just and comprehensive solution to the Mideast issue and the independent development of the country.

Agreement on Cooperation in Trade Signed between DPRK and Venezuela
    Pyongyang, November 15 (KCNA) -- An agreement on cooperation in trade was signed between the governments of the DPRK and the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela in Caracas on Nov. 8.
 It was inked by the minister of Foreign Trade who is heading a government economic delegation of the DPRK and the minister of Light Industry and Commerce of Venezuela.
